contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "are dying" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

This can be stated in active form. AT: "My people are perishing because you, the priests, have not properly taught them about me so that they will obey me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: My people are being destroyed because of the lack of knowledge

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "but the result will be that I will destroy the people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: but it was only so they might be cut off

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The Assyrians will destroy Israel's high places, where the people acted very wickedly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The high places of wickedness will be destroyed

contextId.information: The words "would attack" are left out because they are understood. This can be stated in active form. AT: "like a bear would attack an animal that takes her cubs" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: as a bear that is robbed of her cubs
